ygData.subject: RE: Adventure vacations levels 12-15 *spoilers*
ygData.msgSnippet: I d have to agree with Dan, I spent several days in Kithicor, met Kithicor, he says nothing, met Ged Twigborn he talks about the gloves, met some Shadow
ygData.messageBody:
I'd have to agree with Dan, I spent several days in Kithicor, met Kithicor,
he says nothing, met Ged Twigborn he talks about the gloves, met some Shadow
something or other briefly before he pierced me for 152 points when a wolf
bit me while memorizing a spell. Gotta love that, sit down to mem a spell,
green wolf comes up and bites you, then ranger comes roaring out of the
house before you can even stand and slays you in 15 seconds. This guy is in
the locked house where the guard is outside. Other than that and a few
undead and a couple of orcs I could find nothing in this zone. I wandered
about for about 2 hrs seeing nothing before I sat down to mem and was
promptly slain. Has anyone else found anything useful in this zone? Other
than the trees that don't touch the ground that is.

Kitasi the confused

-----Original Message-----
From: Dan Harmon [mailto:deharmon@...]
Sent: Monday, July 12, 1999 10:57 AM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Adventure vacations levels 12-15 *spoilers*


From: "Dan Harmon" <deharmon@...>

Ok, I'm going to have to ask for even more spoiler. :) I've been to
Kithicor a couple of times, and besides some ruins (stonehenge kind) having
some rather easy (for a lvl 14 druid, and lvl 14 cleric) mummies and green
skels, and occasional green skels that pop up around the lake, we haven't
been able to find any more critters worth beating up on. A few blue spiders
or snakes (can't remember exactly), few & far between.

So what good IS Kithicor? I'm not being a smartass or sarcastic, I'd really
like to know. Please give me some ideas WHERE is good in there.

----- Original Message -----
From: Symber Ash <symber1@...>

> >From: "Elijah Meeker" <elijah@...>
> >everything Kithicor (ALWAYS a good bet for mysterious adventure, there is
a
> bizarre hidden
> >story in that woods, over on Crossroads of Norath/Discussions we have a
> little Kithicor fan club....
>
>
> Finally someone else notices...I get sick of those messages that say
> something like, "We need to get rid of useless zones....like Kithicor"
>
> I adventured there for more than a few levels, and I still get a kick out
of
> that dark place...Have you ever met Kithicor himself? I saw him once by
the
> cabin with the grizzley bears and the flag. He didn't say much...
>
> Ryndal
> Level 18 Bard
> Cazic-Thule
>
